A Funeral Pyre is used during the Shades of Mort'ton quest and minigame to burn shade remains and obtain shade keys.

To burn a shade remains:

  1. Place the correct type of pyre logs (see below) on the pyre.
  2. Place the shade remains on the pyre
  3. Light the shade remains with a tinderbox
  4. A shade key appears on a nearby stone stand. Take the key.

The type of pyre logs that have to be used depends on the type of shade remains you want to burn:

  • Loar and Phrin remains can be burned on any type of pyre logs
  • Riyl remains must be burned on willow pyre logs or better
  • Asyn remains must be burned on yew pyre logs or better
  • Fiyr remains must be burned on magic pyre logs or better
  • Urium remains can only be burned on redwood pyre logs
Burning of shade remains on a Funeral Pyre.

A '''Funeral Pyre''' is used during the [[Shades of Mort'ton]] quest and [[Shades of Mort'ton (minigame)|minigame]] to burn [[shade remains]] and obtain [[shade key]]s.

To burn a shade remains:
#Place the correct type of pyre logs (see below) on the pyre.
#Place the shade remains on the pyre
#Light the shade remains with a [[tinderbox]]
#A [[shade key]] appears on a nearby [[stone stand]]. Take the key.

The type of [[pyre logs (disambiguation)|pyre logs]] that have to be used depends on the type of shade remains you want to burn:
* [[Loar remains|Loar]] and [[Phrin remains]] can be burned on any type of pyre logs
* [[Riyl remains]] must be burned on [[willow pyre logs]] or better
* [[Asyn remains]] must be burned on [[yew pyre logs]] or better
* [[Fiyr remains]] must be burned on [[magic pyre logs]] or better
* [[Urium remains]] can only be burned on [[redwood pyre logs]]
[[File:Shades of Mort'ton - Burning shade remains.gif|thumb|left|Burning of shade remains on a Funeral Pyre.]]
